1.verse: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

2.verse: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

3.verse: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

4.verse: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.

5.verse: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

6.verse: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

7.verse: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

8.verse: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.

9.verse: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

10.verse: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

11.verse: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

12.verse: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

13.verse: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

14.verse: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

15.verse: Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

16.verse: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

17.verse: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

18.verse: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

19.verse: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

20.verse: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the LORD, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

21.verse: But do thou for me, O GOD the Lord, for thy name's sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

22.verse: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

23.verse: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

24.verse: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

25.verse: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

26.verse: Help me, O LORD my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

27.verse: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, LORD, hast done it.

28.verse: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

29.verse: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

30.verse: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

31.verse: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.
